msbt.message: Hoo! A pleasure to meet you! My name is Blathers.I am exceedingly interested in the ecosystem of this island, thus I have come to conduct research, if you will.
Aha! Could it be that you are —the personage who chose the location for this tent?
I am!
That's right.

A splendid job indeed! Thanks to you, I was able to alight on this island with nary a ruffled feather. Now, regarding the aforementioned researchTruth be told, I am determined to open a museum and, henceforth, dwell on this island amongst you.
So, should you discover a new type of insect or fish, do be so kind as to bring it here.I plan to exhibit these creatures, as well as those you gave Tom Nook, in the museum upon its completion.

ThoughI confess, there is one smallish problem regarding said museum. That is, I lack the number of exhibits needed to secure permission to open a museum proper. Empty display cases will not do, I'm told. Display cases with something to display—THAT is another matter!
Which is where you come in, wot wot! Allow me to explainYou see, it is not only insects and fish I plan to display in my esteemed institutionbut fossils too. Hoo!
As it happens, there sits a substantial stretch of land beyond the river. I would bet my pinfeathers this primitive plot is flush with the fossils I require!
Hmmif only there was some way to cross the river

"But the river!" you say. "It cannot be crossed!" you say.Hoo! Silly you! I have a solution as audacious as trying to populate an entirely deserted island. Pardon me, , while I transmit the vital data to your NookPhone

There, you see! With wood gathered from , one can make a lengthy vaulting pole. This pole can be used to propel oneself across the river. Up and over you go, hootie hoo! I sent DIY schematics for a shovel to dig fossils from the ground as well. Which brings me to my point Please, , cross the river and seek out these ancient relics.

My feathers! I have blathered on far too long! But let me leave you with this If I am to open the museum, I must acquire more items to exhibit more, to be precise. I fervently hope you will donate your precious finds to the cause.

Alas, if one is to open a museum, one must first acquire a number of insects, fish, and fossils to display. Indeed, the museum building application is quite strict about such things. But I am overjoyed to report that island residents have donated EVERY specimen needed this very day! Hoot hoot hooray!

Alas, if one is to open a museum, one must first acquire a number of insects, fish, and fossils to display. Indeed, the museum building application is quite strict about such things. But I have good news! The residents of this isle have ALREADY donated every specimen required! Hoot hoot hooray!
Now, since museum construction begins tomorrow, I must pack up this tent shortly. But worry not! Once the museum opens, I shall again accept donations from generous folk.
Hoo! But how could I forget?!I have a little something to assist you when seeking out creatures and curios to donate to the museum. Pardon me, , while I transmit the vital data to your NookPhone

There now. I have sent you two DIY recipes. One is for a vaulting pole, best used for leaping over rivers.The other is for a shovel so you may dig things up and bury them at your leisure. Hoot! I hope these tools serve you well as you set out to explore this island.

Hoo? I say, hoot! I don't believe I know youAh! You must be , the newest addition to our island. An honor to make your acquaintance. If I may, I am Blathers. I came to this island to research its rich ecosystem.More to the point, I am determined to open a museum and, henceforth, make this island my forever home.
And you must be . A hearty welcome indeed.Now, regarding the aforementioned researchTruth be told, I am determined to open a museum and, henceforth, dwell on this island for good.
So, should you discover a new type of insect or fish, do be so kind as to bring it here. Once the museum is open, nothing would please me more than to put your fabulous finds on display.
By the by, it is not only insects and fish I hope to exhibit in my esteemed institutionbut fossils too. Hoo!
With that in mind, I have a little something you might find helpful should you wish to hunt for fossils. A moment, please, while I send the relevant data to your NookPhone

There now. I have sent you two DIY recipes. One is for a vaulting pole, used for leaping over rivers. The other is for a shovel, which you will need to excavate fossils from the ground. Hoot! I do hope you find these useful as you set out to search for fossils.
Anyhoot, I am eager to appraise any fossils you find and, of course, accept fossil donations. So if you come across any such relics, do please bring them to me.
Hoo! If it isn't ! You've come at just the right time!I've just remembered there's something I wanted to give you.Pardon me a moment while I send the data to your NookPhone
! Splendid news, hootie hoo! Fossils have been found on !
Henceforth fossil donations and appraisals shall commence in earnest. I await your contributions with anticipation.

As I am moving forward with the museum application, I am unable to accept new donations at this time. However, I am more than happy to appraise fossils for you. Please do not hesitate to bring them to me!

Furthermore, we have gathered enough donations to proceed with the museum-building application! As I am currently engaged in this endeavor, I cannot take any new donations at this time. However, I'd be happy to appraise any fossils you find. Hoo! Please do not hesitate to bring them to me!
Thank you for visiting!
Please let me know if you have items to donate or need assistance. I am here to help! Hoo!
Make a donation.
Sure thing!
Please let me know if you have items to donate or need assistance. I am here to help! Hoo!
Make a donation.
Assess fossils.
Sure thing!
With this, we need <50_8 x="0" y="0" a="donations" b="donation" c="donations" /> to open the museum!Needless to say, I am eager to accept your continued contributions! Hoo!
I cannot offer much in the way of hospitality, but please make yourself comfortable.
In order to open the museum, we need more exhibit <50_8 x="0" y="0" a="items" b="item" c="items" />!<10_4 /> I do so look forward to your donations!
I cannot offer much in the way of hospitality, but do make yourself comfortable.
I won't be here tomorrow due to the construction, so if you have fossils for me to assess, come by today!

Hoo!<10_9 />Indeed, there can be no doubt. This isa fossil!Incredible! Wonderful! Remarkable! My intuition was impeccable There are fossils on this island! But I digress! Back to the matter at wing. I must assess your fabulous find

Hoo!<10_9 />Indeed, there can be no doubt. This isa fossil!Incredible! Wonderful! Remarkable! My intuition was impeccable There are fossils on this island! But I digress! Back to the matter at wing. I must assess your fabulous find Wot wot? How strangeit seems this fossil has already been identified. How feather-brained of me to forget! Ah, no matter! We made history when we discovered fossils on this island, and THAT is what's important.
Be that as it may
A magnificent specimen indeed!<10_4 /> Once we open the museum, do consider donating it.
My feathers, what a fabulous fossil!This would be a sizable step toward opening the museum I wonderwould you, perhaps, consider donating this ancient relic to the cause?
I'm donating it!
I'll take it home.

My feathers, what a fabulous fossil!And would you believe we needed but one more item to complete the application to build the museum? This could quite literally be the key that unlocks the doors to our institution! Thus it is with great anticipation that I askwill you donate this fossil?
I'm donating it!
I'll take it home.
Yes, now thenThis also applies to the fossil you've brought this time, but
Yes, now thenThe fossil you've brought has already been assessed, but

Only a specialist such as myself can appraise a newly discovered fossil to determine its proper designation. From now on, do please bring me any fossil of unknown origins you find. Whether or not you choose to donate it is up to you. Either way, I shall gladly assess it.
By the by, I wonder if you have anything else that could be donated and—if so—might I take it for you?
I've got something!
Maybe next time.
As you wish. Please come back any time!
HmI do believe this meansYes! Huzzah! Hooray! We have acquired the number of specimens required!

My feathers, I am at a loss for words!Never would I have imagined we could reach our donation goalon this, my very first day on the island! The generosity that made this possible! The passion! I am humbled by the spirit of .Now we can submit our application to build a proper museum!Oh! Oh my! I must make haste and prepare for the museum opening! There's so much to do! Hootie hoo!Thank you so very much, !
At last we can submit our application to build a proper museum! Oh! Oh my! I must make haste and prepare for the museum opening! There's so much to do! Hootie hoo!Thank you so very much, !
Museum construction is about to begin, and thus I cannot accept new donations at this time. However, requests for fossil appraisals are still most welcome!
Assess fossils.
I'm fine.
I am not accepting new donations at this time due to the museum- construction preparations That said, I am still quite eager to uncover fossils, so do let me know if you find any.
Museum construction is about to begin, and thus I cannot accept new donations at this time. However, requests for fossil appraisals are still most welcome!
I found a fossil.
OK.
Hoo! Is that true?!<10_4 /> Why, where might this fossil be now?!
Wot wot?! Changed your mind, have you?My apologies if I got ahead of myself. Ehh Do let me know if you happen to have it on you another time.

! You'll never guess what has transpired!We have collected the donations required for museum approval and construction! Now, I cannot accept donations at this time, as I am terribly busy tending to a great many details. But once the doors open, I do hope you will continue to support our noble cultural endeavor.

Hootie hoo and hello to you! Welcome to !We aspire to build a museum on this very island, you know. Hoo, it's true!To that end, we are surveying the local ecosystem for relevant finds.I apologize for the mess, but encourage you to make yourself most comfortable.
I say, do be sure to stop by again once this island has its own museum!
